bug.short_desc: config.json feature: 'export' attribute of config filters jobs on export

long_desc.thetext:
Mark jobs of a config that is to be included by other configs, so that only marked jobs will be exported to the importing config. This could be achieved through either giving a dedicated key to each job (e.g. 'export : true'), or introduce a top-level key that holds the list of jobs to export (e.g. 'export : ['source', 'build', 'api']).
Implementation of this feature requires that the dependencies of the exported jobs ('extend' and 'run' key values) are being taken care of. This can be achieved through keeping the imported config somewhere in the local config, outside the 'jobs' map. Imported jobs need to keep a reference to their original config. On running an imported job, it will be 'extend'ed and 'run' through the original config's jobs. ('extend'ing could actually be done on import time, but 'run' has to be expanded on run time).
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
